item.title: Machines that learn like humans
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: Artificial Intelligence allow machines to learn patterns from data. The way humans learn however is different and more efficient. With Lifelong Machine Learning, machines can learn the way human beings do, faster, and more efficiently
item.content:encoded: Artificial Intelligence allow machines to learn patterns from data. The way humans learn however is different and more efficient. With Lifelong Machine Learning, machines can learn the way human beings do, faster, and more efficiently

item.itunes:author: Francesco Gadaleta

item.title: Protecting privacy and confidentiality in data and communications
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: Talking about security of communication and privacy is never enough, especially when political instabilities are driving leaders towards decisions that will affect people on a global scale

item.title: 2017 Predictions in Data Science
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: We strongly believe 2017 will be a very interesting year for data science and artificial intelligence. Let me tell you what I expect and why.

item.title: Statistical analysis of phenomena that smell like chaos
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: Is the market really predictable? How do stock prices increase? What is their dynamics? Here is what I think about the magics and the reality of predictions applied to markets and the stock exchange.
item.content:encoded: Is the market really predictable? How do stock prices increase? What is their dynamics? Here is what I think about the magics and the reality of predictions applied to markets and the stock exchange.

item.itunes:author: Francesco Gadaleta

item.title: The minimum required by a data scientist
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: Why the job of the data scientist can disappear soon. What is required by a data scientist to survive inflation.

item.title: Data Science and Fraud Detection at iZettle
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: Data science is making the difference also in fraud detection. In this episode I have a conversation with an expert in the field, Engineer Eyad Sibai, who works at iZettle, a fraud detection company

item.title: EU Regulations and the rise of Data Hijackers
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: Extracting knowledge from large datasets with large number of variables is always tricky. Dimensionality reduction helps in analyzing high dimensional data, still maintaining most of the information hidden behind complexity. Here are some methods that you must try before further analysis (Part 1).

Here are some methods that you must try before further analysis (Part 1).

item.title: History and applications of Deep Learning
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: What is deep learning?If you have no patience, deep learning is the result of training many layers of non-linear processing units for feature extraction and data transformation e.g. from pixel, to edges, to shapes, to object classification, to scene description, captioning, etc.
item.content:encoded: What is deep learning?If you have no patience, deep learning is the result of training many layers of non-linear processing units for feature extraction and data transformation e.g. from pixel, to edges, to shapes, to object classification, to scene description, captioning, etc.

item.title: Frequentists and Bayesians
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: There are statisticians and data scientists… Among statisticians, there are some who just count. Some others who… think differently. In this show we explore the old time dilemma between frequentists and bayesians.Given a statistical problem, who’s going to be right?
item.content:encoded: There are statisticians and data scientists... Among statisticians, there are some who just count. Some others who… think differently. In this show we explore the old time dilemma between frequentists and bayesians.Given a statistical problem, who’s going to be right?

item.itunes:author: Francesco Gadaleta

item.title: 30 min with data scientist Sebastian Raschka
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: In this show I interview Sebastian Raschka, data scientist and author of Python Machine Learning.In addition to the fun we had offline, there are great elements about machine learning, data science, current and future trends, to keep an ear on. Moreover, it is the conversation of two data scientists who contribute and operate in the field, on a daily basis.
item.content:encoded: In this show I interview Sebastian Raschka, data scientist and author of Python Machine Learning.In addition to the fun we had offline, there are great elements about machine learning, data science, current and future trends, to keep an ear on. Moreover, it is the conversation of two data scientists who contribute and operate in the field, on a daily basis.

item.title: How to be data scientist
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: In this episode, we tell you how to become data scientist and join an amazing community that is changing the world with data analytics.

item.title: Data Science and Bio-Inspired Algorithms
item.dc:creator: datascienceathome
item.description: In this episode I meet Dr Eliseo Ferrante, formerly at the University of Leuven, currently researcher at the Université de Technologie de Compiègne, who studies self-organization and evolution.
